revised_title: Molecular Scattering in Gases: The Method of Crossed Molecular Beams
tldr: The authors developed a method called the "crossed molecular beams" technique to study molecular collisions in gases. They used a beam of alkali metal atoms and a heavy, slow-moving molecule as a scatterer. The scattered atoms were collected using a surface ionization gauge, allowing them to measure the angular distribution of the scattered atoms. This method provided a direct experimental study of collision phenomena in gases, offering a new way to investigate intermolecular interactions.
